The Congressional Budget Act of 1974 outlines the process for subdivisions of budget allocations among subcommittees or programs. Committees must report these subdivisions to their respective Houses. Amendment to the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 allows for floor amendments to appropriations bills that reduce budget authority and relevant subcommittee allocations. The amendment in the bill reduces subcommittee allocations and discretionary spending limits for the fiscal year and the following four years.
